method.text: Lightly grease and line a 20 cm round spring clip cake tin.

Whisk the eggs and sugar together until thick and pale. Sift the flour and salt into a bowl and fold a little at a time into the egg mixture. Fold in the lemon and orange rind and juice. Then spoon into the prepared tin.
Bake in the oven for 30 min or until well risen and firm. Cool for 5-10 min. Then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
To make the filling, lightly beat the cheese and cream together with the icing sugar until smooth. Then mix a third of the cheese mixture with the lemon curd.
Slice the cake in half horizontally. Place one half on a serving plate and spread over the citrus filling.

Place the other half on top, to form a sandwich. Spread the remaining cheese and cream mixture over the top and sides of the cake. Decorate the sides with chopped hazelnuts and the top with orange slices, mint sprigs and orange rind. Serve in slices.
